{{Adaptation}} {{infobox character | people=[[Men|Man]] | name=Mika Milovana | image=The Hobbit (1967 film) - Princess Mika Milovana.png | caption="Mika Milovana" from [[The Hobbit (1967 film)|''The Hobbit'' (1967 film)]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles=Princess | position= | location=[[Dale]] | affiliation= | language= | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage=Unnamed father | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Female | height= | hair=Blonde | eyes=Black | clothing=White crown
Brown dress depicting the [[Arkenstone]] | weapons= | steed= }} '''Mika Milovana''' was the princess of [[Dale]] in the [[The Hobbit (1967 film)|1967 adaptation]] of ''[[The Hobbit]]''.{{webcite|articleurl=http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=UBnVL1Y2src|articlename=The Hobbit.mp4|dated=5-Jan-2012|website=[http://www.youtube.com/ YouTube]|accessed=17-Feb-2012}} == History == Princess Mika Milovana was one of three who survived the destruction of [[Dale]] by the dragon [[Smaug|Slag]], the others being a watchman and [[Thorin|General Torin Oakenshield]]. The Princess got angry when [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo]] refused to accept his prophesied role of the dragon killer. She declared that the dragon killed her father and her people and that she would go alone to the [[Lonely Mountain]] if need be. Dismayed that a child should enter into such peril, Bilbo agreed to go. After Bilbo had killed Slag, Dale was restored. Bilbo and Mika reigned there together for a time before they returned to [[Hobbiton]]. == Etymology == According to [[Gene Deitch]], the director of [[The Hobbit (1967 film)|''The Hobbit'' (1967 film)]], the Princess was named after [[Wikipedia:Pete Seeger|Pete Seegerâ€™s]] eldest daughter "[[Wikipedia:Mika Seeger|Mika]]". Her second name, "Milovana", 'means a beloved woman' in [[Wikipedia:Czech language|Czech]].{{webcite|author=[[Gene Deitch]]|articleurl=https://genedeitchcredits.wordpress.com/roll-the-credits/40-william-l-snyder/|articlename=William L. Snyder|dated=Jan-12-2012|website=[http://genedeitchcredits.wordpress.com genedeitchcredits]|accessed=20-Jan-2021}} {{References}} [[Category:Men from adaptations]]
